newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek state telecom union opposes new advisors.
newsitem.headline: Greek state telecom union opposes new advisors.

text.p: OME-OTE, the OTE state telecoms union, said on Monday it opposes a management decision last week to hire Bellcore, Telecom Italia and Price Waterhouse to advise on two major contracts on digital switching devices.
The advisers were retained to advise OTE on network design, procurement procedures for 2,000,000 digital switches for the period to 2000 and an overhaul of the OTE procurement system.

The group will also negotiate over the next month with local Intracom and Siemens Hellas, a subsidiary of Germany's Siemens AG, concerning an immediate order for 335,000 new digital switches for the first quarter of 1997.
OME OTE said it opposed the decision as studies on network development by Coopers & Lybrant and NTT had been carried out and had cost OTE dearly during the conservative New Democracy administration.
It also stated that OTE had considerable know-how on such matters and had offered to design the basic network of other Balkan telecoms.

"Given OTE management's and the government's position on collective procurement agreements we ask what purpose is being served by the retainment of foreign advisers who have relationships with OTE's foreign suppliers," OME OTE said in a statement.

Warning that it would actively oppose the decision, the Federation of Workers in Greek Telecommunications (OME-OTE) said the decision by OTE's management would waste public money and cause further delays in OTE's development plan.
OTE shares were trading down 15 drachmas at 4,055 in moderate volume.
